required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Randomizing Two Gestational Diabetes Screening Methods in a Diverse HMO
clinical_study.official_title: Comparing Two Gestational Diabetes Screening Methods: A Pragmatic Outpatient RCT

collaborator.agency: Eunice Kennedy Shriver National Institute of Child Health and Human Development (NICHD)

brief_summary.textblock: This project randomizes two different screening strategies for diabetes in pregnancy, among a study population of over 17,500 pregnant women and their babies (over 35,000 total) in a large diverse health maintenance organization (HMO), to determine how diagnosis and treatment based on these two strategies in routine clinical care affects complications for the baby and the mother.

detailed_description.textblock: Two recent randomized placebo-controlled trials show that gestational diabetes (GDM) treatment (vs. none) improves maternal and perinatal outcomes, based on diagnosis with a 2- step screening strategy. Also, a large multi-center prospective cohort study showed a linear relationship with glucose and maternal and perinatal outcomes, based on screening with a single 75g oral glucose tolerance test (OGTT). Based on this large cohort's findings, the American Diabetes Association recommended that clinical practice adopt the 1-step 75g screening approach for diagnosing GDM. The American College of Obstetrics & Gynecology took the opposite stance, recommending the traditional 2-step screening: because it alone has RCT outcome evidence. What is urgently needed to best inform clinical practice and health policy is not an additional GDM treatment vs. control trial, but a pragmatic randomized controlled trial (RCT) testing the 2 recommended clinical strategies. To pragmatically address this critical research gap, we propose to randomize an estimated 17,626 diverse women to GDM screening (2-step vs. 75g OGTT) as part of their clinical care in the Kaiser Permanente Northwest (KPNW) and Hawaii (KPH) regional health plans. The investigators will use the plans' electronic medical record (EMR) system at the time of GDM screening to randomize the women. Both KPNW and KPH regions universally screen for GDM at 24-28 weeks gestation, as part of clinical care. By randomizing GDM screening in the context of clinical care, the investigators will: Compare GDM prevalences (Aim 1) and differences in maternal and perinatal outcomes between screening strategies (Aim 2). Determine the concordance of the 75g OGTT with GDM diagnosed by 2-step, among a recruited sub-sample of 1,000 pregnant women at KPNW and KPH (Aim 3). The results of this pragmatic RCT are expected to help resolve the current public policy debate on the potential benefits and risks of each strategy in clinical obstetric practice.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Pregnancies with GDM diagnosis
primary_outcome.time_frame: During Pregnancy to Delivery, up to 10 months
primary_outcome.description: Diagnosis of GDM based on laboratory values for each screening approach (1-step or 2-step) as planned in the original protocol.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Newborns with Large for Gestational Age (LGA) Birthweight
Number of neonates with any component of a composite perinatal outcome
primary_outcome.time_frame: Birth to first year of life
primary_outcome.description: Includes any of the following: number of neonatal deaths, stillbirths, shoulder dystocia, bone fracture, or nerve palsy

primary_outcome.measure: Number of pregnant women with Gestational Hypertension & Pre-Eclampsia
primary_outcome.time_frame: During Pregnancy to Delivery, up to 10 months
primary_outcome.description: Based on International Classification of Diseases (ICD-10) diagnoses

primary_outcome.time_frame: During Pregnancy to Delivery, up to 10 months

secondary_outcome.description: Will evaluate macrosomia, large for gestational age (LGA), small for gestational age (SGA) and average birthweight. LGA remains a primary outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Pregnant Women with GDM Requiring Treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During Pregnancy to Delivery, up to 10 months
secondary_outcome.description: Maternal GDM requiring insulin or oral hypoglycemic treatment (class A2GDM)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Birth to first year of life
secondary_outcome.description: Number of pregnancies for which newborn has a diagnosis of neonatal respiratory distress syndrome; planned in the original protocol.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Birth to first year of life
secondary_outcome.description: Number of pregnancies for which newborn has a diagnosis of jaundice and received jaundice treatment; planned in the original protocol.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Birth to first year of life
secondary_outcome.description: Number of pregnancies for which newborn has a diagnosis of neonatal hypoglycemia; planned in the original protocol.
Stillbirth is a secondary outcome; miscarriages were excluded
Death of newborn under age 7 days

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Infants with Shoulder Dystocia
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Birth to first year of life

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Infant Bone Fractures or Nerve Palsies associated with delivery
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Birth to first year of life

other_outcome.description: Safety outcome. Number of pregnancies for which newborn has a diagnosis of neonatal sepsis
Safety outcome. Number of pregnancies for which newborn is admitted to the NICU

other_outcome.measure: Preterm delivery (both <37 weeks and <32 weeks of gestation)
other_outcome.description: Safety outcome. Number of pregnancies in which delivery took place before 37 weeks of gestation; separately, number or pregnancies in which delivery took place before 32 weeks of gestation

other_outcome.time_frame: During Pregnancy to Delivery, up to 10 months
other_outcome.description: Safety outcome. Number of pregnancies in which labor was induced

other_outcome.time_frame: Pre-pregnancy, 1st trimester, 2nd trimester, 3rd trimester and overall to delivery, up to 10 months

other_outcome.measure: Changes in pre-pregnancy to post-partum maternal weight
other_outcome.description: Maternal height and weight measurements to evaluate average weight retention post-partum compared to pre-pregnancy

other_outcome.measure: Number of Pregnancies with Multiple Maternal and Child GDM-Associated Outcomes
other_outcome.time_frame: Beginning of Pregnancy up to 10 years post-partum
other_outcome.description: This pragmatic GDM screening RCT evaluates rates of multiple maternal and child GDM-associated outcomes with two standard-of-care screening strategies in a large population of pregnant women at two diverse HMO sites with routine universal screening for GDM. This first primary outcome encompasses the overarching goals of our pragmatic RCT, and other specific primary outcomes will be listed as subsequent primary outcome measures. This outcome was initially registered as an overall primary outcome and was intended (as stated in the study protocol) to include the number of pregnancies diagnosed with GDM based on laboratory values of the two screening approaches; the primary GDM diagnosis has been updated separately as a primary outcome as per protocol.

other_outcome.measure: Number and Intensity of Utilization of Health Care Services
other_outcome.time_frame: During Pregnancy to Delivery, up to 10 months
other_outcome.description: Quantification of health care visits, labs, procedures, and pharmacy for each pregnant woman

other_outcome.measure: Changes in childhood height and weight measures
other_outcome.time_frame: Annually after birth up to 10 years
other_outcome.description: We will evaluate childhood growth percentiles and trajectories, as well as incidence of childhood overweight and obesity

other_outcome.measure: Number of mothers with post-partum diabetes
other_outcome.time_frame: Annually after birth up to 10 years
other_outcome.description: Development of post-partum diabetes by ICD-10 diagnoses and lab measurement

other_outcome.measure: Number of women with Post-partum depression
other_outcome.description: Based on maternal ICD-10 diagnoses and questionnaire assessment

other_outcome.measure: Number of children with metabolic syndrome
other_outcome.time_frame: Annually from birth up to 10 years
other_outcome.description: Based on ICD-10 diagnoses and also measured components including blood pressure, lipid measurements, body mass index, and diabetes
vaginal deliveries requiring assistance, including forceps and vacuum extraction

other_outcome.measure: Number of pregnant women with anxiety or depression
other_outcome.time_frame: During Pregnancy to Delivery, up to 10 months
other_outcome.description: Based on ICD-10 diagnoses and questionnaire assessment

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- pregnant adult women in KPNW and KPH
Exclusion Criteria:
- pre-existing diabetes

overall_official.affiliation: KP Center for Health Resarch, NW & Hawaii
